responses.rationale: The segment describes negative impacts (changes, cancellations) but contains no explicit calming cues.
Reports a positive fact (mild symptoms) but lacks explicit calming language or intensification.
Reports a low risk fact ('remains low') but lacks explicit calming language or intensification ('very low', 'extremely low'). This is a bare low-risk statement.
Reports a negative fact (layoffs) but contains no explicit calming cues.
Describes a negative impact (disrupted traditions) but contains no explicit calming cues.
Reports a negative impact (unable to show) but contains no explicit calming cues.
Reports a negative impact (unable to show) but contains no explicit calming cues.
Reports actions taken (strict testing, measures) but lacks explicit calming language linked to public safety.
Reports a requirement (must test negative) but lacks explicit calming language.
Reports outcomes (restrictions, cancellations) but lacks explicit calming language.
Reports actions taken (made changes to lessen chances) but lacks explicit calming language.
Reports conditions (allowed if test negative) but lacks explicit calming language.
Reports action taken (excluded as precaution) but lacks explicit calming language.
Reports action taken (canceled attractions) but lacks explicit calming language.
Reports guidance/suggestions (take steps to protect, stressing measures) but lacks explicit calming language.
Expresses negative emotion ('very heartbreaking') but contains no explicit calming cues.
Makes a prediction ('going to be around next year') but contains no explicit calming cues.
Expresses uncertainty ('don't know what next year's going to hold') but contains no explicit calming cues.
Reports a negative situation ('problems finding suitable land') but contains no explicit calming cues.
Describes the situation ('fighting another outbreak') but contains no explicit calming cues.
Describes a negative situation with vivid language ('so bad', 'record', 'stressing', 'struggling') but lacks explicit calming cues.
Reports the purpose of an action ('prevent the risk') but lacks explicit calming language.
Reports the reason for a restriction ('due to fears of contamination') but lacks explicit calming language.
Reports actions taken ('addressing the problem by securing... or by incinerating') but lacks explicit calming language.
Reports a limitation ('not all of them have enough capacity') but lacks explicit calming language.
Reports a negative impact ('impacting food prices') but contains no explicit calming cues.
Reports a negative impact ('impacts food prices') but contains no explicit calming cues.
Reports a negative impact ('impacts food prices') but contains no explicit calming cues.
Reports actions taken ('have suspended certain food items') but lacks explicit calming language.
Reports actions taken ('have suspended egg-related items') but lacks explicit calming language.
Describes the situation ('ongoing bird flu outbreak globally that's affecting') but contains no explicit calming cues.
Reports a fact ('detected a highly pathogenic bird flu virus'). 'highly pathogenic' is a technical term.
Reports actions taken ('slaughter the chickens and disinfect... to prevent the spread') but lacks explicit calming language.
Reports a negative fact ('virus is spreading quickly again') but contains no explicit calming cues.
Reports facts ('Several cases of severe bird flu had already been detected') and actions ('prompting the government to impose') but lacks explicit calming cues.
Reports negative facts/impacts ('massive wave', 'cull over 3 million ducks') but lacks explicit calming cues.
Reports a negative impact ('prompt... to impose trade restrictions') but contains no explicit calming cues.
Reports a reaction ('raising concern among epidemiologists'). This is a psychological verb without intensification or scale.
Reports a fact ('often spread by migrating wild birds') but contains no explicit calming cues.
Reports a difficulty ('hard to keep the virus out') but contains no explicit calming cues.
Reports facts ('cases... have predictably begun popping up') but contains no explicit calming cues.
Reports positive facts ('only a small portion... has been affected', 'allowing prices to fall') but lacks explicit calming language.
Reports a fact (price remained at $2.07) but contains no explicit calming cues.
Reports a fact (price has climbed) but contains no explicit calming cues.
Reports positive facts ('haven't been hit as hard', 'less chance of infection') but lacks explicit calming language.
Reports a positive fact (price down) but lacks explicit calming language.
Reports actions taken ('gone to great lengths by requiring... sanitizing... investing') but lacks explicit calming language.
Reports actions taken ('upgraded... installed') but lacks explicit calming language.
Reports emphasis on action ('stress from here is biosecurity') but lacks explicit calming language.
Reports a negative fact (cost $757 million) but contains no explicit calming cues.
Reports facts comparing outbreaks ('more widespread', 'remains less costly') but lacks explicit calming language.
This is a bare negation ('doesn't represent a significant health threat') and falls under Q7, not Q5.
The phrase 'extremely rare' is an intensified low-risk evaluation, matching the Q5 criteria for Reassuring.
Reports a fact about a safety measure ('will also kill any viruses') but lacks explicit calming language.
Reports facts about vaccines ('being developed', 'might help', 'remain impractical') but lacks explicit calming language.
